summary: This is an email exchange between two individuals, likely within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. The sender, Capone, is identified as the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit.

persons.name: Capone
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, requesting a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. They hold a leadership position in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Watson
persons.context: A former supervisor who was temporarily replaced by the email recipient while Watson was on an 18-month temporary duty assignment at headquarters.

connections.description: Both are associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Capone leading the Public Corruption Unit and Watson being a former supervisor.

events.title: Meeting Request on Epstein Case
events.description: Capone emails a colleague to request a meeting to discuss the Epstein case.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated June 12, 2019, indicating ongoing activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
Capone, Chief of the Public Corruption Unit for the SDNY, is directly involved in the Epstein case.
The correspondence shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the case.
